title: Teacher Collaboration Workshop for Differentiated Mathematics Instruction Design: Focused on Computational and Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level mathematical theories (equations, functions, statistics) and high-level application skills (graph interpretation, problem-solving strategies)
context.additional_context: Focuses on enhancing teachers' competencies to design and operate differentiated instruction in online environments for students with diverse learning levels, particularly emphasizing improvements in mathematical thinking (logical reasoning, spatial perception) and computational skills.

learning_goals: Design ≥3 systematic assessment tools (diagnostic tests, formative assessments, portfolio evaluations) that analyze learners' varying readiness levels and learning profiles.

Apply ≥5 differentiated instructional strategies (content, process, product, and environmental differentiation) tailored to mathematics subject characteristics (calculations, formulas, graphs, problem-solving) in actual classes.
Collaborate with peer teachers to develop ≥2 customized instructional materials (step-by-step problem sets, concept visualization tools) reflecting learner needs.

Trainees will generate monthly learner engagement and achievement reports using data collected from an online learning platform (LMS) (login frequency, quiz submission rate, video completion rate, problem-solving accuracy) and deliver personalized feedback messages (individual learning plans, error analysis) to the bottom 20% in engagement.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
